intro: Rosa alpina var. hircina, commonly known as the Alpine sheep rose, is a perennial shrub native to the alpine regions of Europe. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, fragrant flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically produces rose-like blooms in late spring to early summer, often in clusters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and covered in a fine layer of white down. This variety is well adapted to harsh mountain environments, thriving in poor, well-drained soils.
